Description: A tile made of blue glazed composition in the form of a vertical column of hieroglyphic text featuring epithets of the king. The signs and the vertical lines framing them on either side are empty, their inlays now lost. The body of the tile is made from a pale beige ceramic with a thin layer of blue glazed composition overlying it; the sides and back are smooth. This tile is composed of two fragments that have been reassembled.
Curator's comments: This tile features traditional epithets of the king, which highlight his power and idealised role as unifier of Egypt. It would have been part of a longer inscription and titulary, which likely featured on a palace doorframe.
